name: Mamucium Fort Plan â€” Archaeological Reconstruction (79 AD)
description: Archaeological excavation plans of the Roman fort at Mamucium (Castlefield). Multiple excavations from 1906 onwards have revealed the fort layout, gates, granaries, and vicus.
notes:
RESEARCH TARGET: Find published excavation plans of Mamucium.

Key excavations:
- 1906: Charles Roeder excavation
- 1972: G.D.B. Jones excavation (University of Manchester)
- 2001-2005: University of Manchester Vicus excavations

Published plans likely in:
- 'Roman Manchester' by G.D.B. Jones (1974)
- 'Roman Manchester: The University of Manchester Excavations within the Vicus 2001-5' (Oxford Archaeology North)
- Greater Manchester Archaeological Unit reports: http://www.gmau.manchester.ac.uk/pdfs/rmc1.pdf
- Journal of Roman Studies / Britannia journal articles

Fort location: Castlefield, between Liverpool Road and the Medlock.
Fort dimensions: approx 160m x 130m.
Timber phase c.79 AD, stone rebuild c.160 AD, final phase c.200 AD.
Vicus (civilian settlement) extended east and south of fort.

Contact: UoM Archaeology dept, GMAU, Manchester Museum.
